documents.name: [In-work] privacy details/policy
documents.text:
DetailsCookies and such

<Some discussion here>

Analytics

We are using Plausible, a privacy first analytics platform, for our web analytics. Plausible collects minimal amounts of data  about your visit using no cookies. It is, by default and limits, completely GDPR compliant. Plausible's results looks like this: https://plausible.io/plausible.io. These analytics do not tell us much that is personal, but still help us reasonably tune our site to your needs.

<embed sohl plausible analytics here>

‍SoHl tech stack profiles:

https://builtwith.com/sohl.party

https://w3techs.com/sites/info/sohl.party

Data handling and such

Headings, paragraphs, blockquotes, figures, images, and figure captions can all be styled after a class is added to the rich text element using the "When inside of" nested selector system.

points.title: You can access most of the pages on the service's website without revealing any personal information
points.quoteText: These analytics do not tell us much that is personal

points.title: Third parties are involved in operating the service
Only necessary logs are kept by the service to ensure quality
points.quoteText: Plausible collects minimal amounts of data  about your visit using no cookies.

points.title: The service claims to be GDPR compliant for European users
points.quoteText: It is, by default and limits, completely GDPR compliant.
